header.title: Framer Motion & UI Animation
header.description: Master React animations with Framer Motion: gestures, drag, layout animations, page transitions, and performance optimization.

motionBasics.title: Motion Component Basics
motionBasics.description: Understanding the core building blocks of Framer Motion

whatIsMotionDiv.title: What is motion.div?
whatIsMotionDiv.content: Framer Motion's basic unit is the motion component. It wraps any HTML element to enable declarative animations that integrate seamlessly with React state.
whatIsMotionDiv.stateDrivenDesc: Animations react to React state changes
whatIsMotionDiv.composableDesc: Works with Variants for complex animations

demo.title: Interactive Demo
demo.label: Fade & Slide Animation
demo.noteDesc: This simple toggle doesn't animate exit. For exit animations, you need AnimatePresence (covered later).

animatableProps.title: Animatable Properties
animatableProps.performanceTipDesc: Transform properties (x, y, scale, rotate) are GPU-accelerated and don't trigger layout recalculation. Prefer these over width/height for better performance.

variants.title: Variants
variants.description: State-based animation patterns for complex orchestration

whatAreVariants.title: What are Variants?
whatAreVariants.content: Variants are named animation states that can be referenced by string. They enable:

variantPropagation.title: Variant Propagation
variantPropagation.content: When a parent component changes to a new variant, all children with the same variant names automatically animate to match. This creates coordinated animations without explicit wiring.

orchestrationOptions.title: Orchestration Options
orchestrationOptions.staggerChildrenDesc: Delay between each child animation start
orchestrationOptions.staggerDirectionDesc: 1 = first to last, -1 = last to first

gesture.title: Gesture-Based Interactions
gesture.description: Create responsive UI with hover, tap, focus, and scroll animations

eventHandlers.title: Gesture Event Handlers
eventHandlers.content: Framer Motion provides callbacks for gesture events:

drag.title: Drag & Drop
drag.description: Build draggable UI components with physics-based interactions

dragOptions.title: Drag Options
dragOptions.dragMomentumDesc: Continue moving after release based on velocity (default: true)
dragOptions.dragTransitionDesc: Configure the momentum animation: bounceStiffness, bounceDamping
dragOptions.dragDirectionLockDesc: Lock to detected direction after threshold

dragWithMomentum.title: Drag with Momentum
dragWithMomentum.note: Swipe horizontally and release to see momentum

layout.title: Layout Animation
layout.description: Automatic smooth transitions when layout changes

magic.title: The Magic of layout Prop
magic.content: When you add the layout prop, Framer Motion automatically animates between layout changes (position, size) using performant transforms. This is nearly impossible to achieve with CSS alone.

accordion.title: Accordion Example
accordion.content: This content smoothly expands and collapses. The parent container automatically animates its size change, and the title stays in position using layout="position".

layoutPropOptions.title: Layout Prop Options
layoutPropOptions.layoutDesc: Animate both position and size changes
layoutPropOptions.layoutPositionDesc: Only animate position, not size (prevents text distortion)
layoutPropOptions.layoutSizeDesc: Only animate size changes, not position
layoutPropOptions.layoutIdDesc: Shared layout animations across different components

presence.title: AnimatePresence
presence.description: Animate components when they mount and unmount

problem.title: The Problem
problem.content: React immediately removes elements from the DOM when they unmount. This means exit animations are impossible without AnimatePresence, which keeps elements in the DOM during their exit animation.

modal.title: Modal Example
modal.modalContent: This modal has smooth enter and exit animations!

modes.title: AnimatePresence Modes
modes.syncDesc: Enter and exit animations happen simultaneously
modes.waitDesc: Wait for exit to complete before entering (good for page transitions)
modes.popLayoutDesc: Exiting elements are removed from layout flow immediately

transition.title: Transitions & Springs
transition.description: Fine-tune animation timing with springs, tweens, and keyframes

springPhysics.title: Spring Physics (Default)
springPhysics.content: Framer Motion uses spring physics by default because they create more natural, responsive animations. Unlike duration-based tweens, springs respond to interruption smoothly.

compare.title: Compare Animation Types
compare.springNote: Notice the natural bounce and overshoot

performance.title: Performance & Accessibility
performance.description: Optimize animations for performance and inclusive design

performanceTips.title: Performance Tips
performanceTips.useTransformDesc: x, y, scale, rotate are GPU-accelerated. Avoid animating width, height, top, left.
performanceTips.limitSimultaneousDesc: Too many animating elements at once can cause jank. Be selective.
performanceTips.willChangeDesc: Framer Motion handles this automatically. Don't add it manually.
performanceTips.layoutExpensiveDesc: Use layout prop judiciously. Consider layout="position" when possible.

reducedMotion.title: Accessibility: Reduced Motion
reducedMotion.content: Some users experience motion sickness or have vestibular disorders. Always respect the prefers-reduced-motion system preference.

antiPatterns.title: Animation Anti-patterns
antiPatterns.animatingLayoutDesc: width/height cause reflow. Use scale transform instead.
antiPatterns.tooManyLayoutDesc: Each layout animation requires measuring. Use sparingly.
antiPatterns.animatingEverythingDesc: Purposeless animation is distracting. Each animation should serve UX.
antiPatterns.longDurationsDesc: Keep animations under 300ms for UI. Users perceive long animations as slow.

goodPrinciples.title: Good Animation Principles
goodPrinciples.consistencyDesc: Same elements should animate the same way
